repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Fix #35431

Also avoid repeated calls of compute_foldcolumn().

comment_data.body: Hmm its a bit weird that just specifying `MIN(wp->w_view_width, 3)`  isn't enough. `grid_line_flush()` is not supposed to touch cells outside the total [min, max) range of all interleaving calls...
`win_draw_end()` is the place where the drawing exceeded the viewport, not here.

This is still a change that is happening in this PR and I want to understand what it is changing.

I looked for all the places where `grid_line_start()` is called with something else than -1 to understand what the changes in logic are and if it can be done by fixing min/max col args in the interleaving calls instead of making the signature of `grid_line_start()` more complicated. Thus I need to understand the point of every single such change.

but if this is the **only** callsite which truly is changed I'd rather wrap the grid_line_fill/put calls right here with `MIN(foo, width)` and/or if statements, than changing the signature of `grid_line_start()` (which affects code which just wants to draw with already correct column args in every other place)

When passing the `w_grid` of a window, the drawing should be limited to `w_view_width`. When the grid doesn't not correspond to a window, there is no such limit. This is similar to this condition in `draw_col_buf()`:
```c
  while (ptr < text + len && wlv->off < wp->w_view_width) {
```
I agree. it is just that this is already in the `grid_line_fill()` here, is it not?
Yes, but `grid_line_fill()` uses `grid_line_maxcol`, which is equal to `grid->cols - col`, not `w_view_width` (which may be 1 smaller due to the right border).
Thinking about this a bit more, since there is already a `n < wp->w_view_width` check in `win_draw_end()`, adding more `MIN(wp->w_width, ` there does make sense.
Since there is already a `n < wp->w_view_width` check below, adding more `MIN(wp->w_width,` above that does make sense.

title: fix(floatwin): handle viewport width properly at end of window
